       throws java.io.IOException

       throws java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

        height - The height, in tiles, of the screen.
        Throws:

    • Method Detail

      • addCanvasToFrame

        public java.awt.Frame addCanvasToFrame()
        Adds the screen's canvas to a Frame and sets the frame to visible.
        Returns:
        A frame with the canvas on it.

      • addCanvasToFullScreenFrame

        public java.awt.Frame addCanvasToFullScreenFrame(@NonNull
                                                 java.awt.GraphicsDevice device)
        Adds the screen's canvas to a Frame, sets the frame to visible, and enables full-screen exclusive mode on the Frame, for a specific device (monitor).
        Parameters:
        device - The device (monitor) to enable full-screen for.
        Returns:
        A full-screened frame with the canvas on it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the device is null.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draws all of the screen's tiles onto the canvas.

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(Component component)
        Adds a component to the screen. This function should never be called when the parameter is a layer within a layer. It will throw-off the algorithm that adjusts the bounding box offsets for all of the components.
        Parameters:
        component - The component.

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent(Component component)
        Removes a component from the screen.
        Parameters:
        component - The component.

      • removeAllComponents

        public void removeAllComponents()
        Removes all components from the screen.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(java.util.EventListener eventListener)
        Adds an event listener to the canvas.
        Parameters:
        eventListener - The event listener.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the event listener isn't supported by this function.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(java.util.EventListener eventListener)
        Removes an event listener from the canvas.
        Parameters:
        eventListener - The event listener.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the event listener isn't supported by this function.

        public java.util.List<Component> getComponentsByID(java.lang.String id)
        Retrieves all components which use a specific ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID to search for.
        Returns:

        public java.awt.Point getMousePosition()
        Retrieves the last known tile-based position of the mouse.
        Returns:
        The last known tile-based position of the mouse.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Retrieves the width, also known as the total number of columns, in the component.
        Returns:
        The width of the grid.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Retrieves the height, also known as the total number of rows, in the component.
        Returns:
        The height of the grid.

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(int x,
                      int y)
        Retrieves a tile from the screen.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-axis coordinate of the tile to retrieve.
        y - The y-axis coordinate of the tile to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The tile, or null if the coordinates are outside the bounds of the screen.

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(java.awt.Point position)
        Retrieves a tile from the screen.
        Parameters:
        position - The x/y-axis coordinates of the tile to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The tile, or null if the coordinates are outside the bounds of the screen or if the position is null.

      • setColorPalette

        public void setColorPalette(@NonNull
                            ColorPalette colorPalette)
        Sets the fore/background color of every tile on the screen to the default fore/background colors of a ColorPalette. This does not affect child components and this is not permanent. These color changes may be overwritten during a draw call.
        Parameters:
        colorPalette - The color palette.
